chunk_text: Austrolebias bellottii is a species of fish that lives in the basins of the Paraná River and Uruguay River, in Argentina and Uruguay.  It flows from north to south and forms parts of the boundaries of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, separating some of the Argentine provinces of La Mesopotamia from the other two countries.
explanation_text: The river that Austrolebias bellotti are found in flows from north to south, which is evident from its course that forms parts of the boundaries of Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay. This direction of flow is also reflected in the fact that it separates some of the Argentine provinces of La Mesopotamia from the other two countries.

chunk_text: Imqaret (pronounced Im'aret, accented on a) is a traditional Maltese sweet made with pastry and a filling of dates.
